abstract: Banks are making money hand over fist in the era of low interest rates. Savers, however, are making next to nothing, Floyd Norris writes in his latest column in The New York Times.
snippet: Banks are making money hand over fist in the era of low interest rates. Savers, however, are making next to nothing, Floyd Norris writes in his latest column in The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: Aren’t low short-term interest rates wonderful? If you are a bank, the answer is yes, particularly because the low rates are accompanied by somewhat higher longer-term rates. If you are a saver, however, your view might be very different, Floyd Norris writes in his latest column in The New York Times.

headline.main: Norris: Low Rates Good for Banks, but Pity the Saver

abstract: Bank of America Merrill Lynch and Symphony Asset Management have joined forces on a new $500 million collateralized loan obligation, Bloomberg News and The Wall Street Journal reported.
snippet: Bank of America Merrill Lynch and Symphony Asset Management have joined forces on a new $500 million collateralized loan obligation, Bloomberg News and The Wall Street Journal reported.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America Merrill Lynch and Symphony Asset Management have joined forces on a new $500 million collateralized loan obligation, Bloomberg News and The Wall Street Journal reported.

headline.main: BofA and Symphony Team Up for C.L.O., Reports Say

abstract: Bank of America on Friday reported a #3.2 bilion profit for the first quarter this year, as the firm rebounded strongly from the depths of the credit crisis and saw improvements in all its businesses.
snippet: Bank of America on Friday reported a #3.2 bilion profit for the first quarter this year, as the firm rebounded strongly from the depths of the credit crisis and saw improvements in all its businesses.
lead_paragraph: 7:46 a.m. | Updated The New York Times’s Andrew Martin has more here.

abstract: The bank, which is often considered an economic bellwether, said its net credit losses dropped 5 percent in the first quarter.
snippet: The bank, which is often considered an economic bellwether, said its net credit losses dropped 5 percent in the first quarter.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America’s acquisition of Merrill Lynch, a marriage made under the storm cloud of the financial crisis, has been the subject of government investigations and shareholder lawsuits ever since it became official in early 2009.

headline.main: Bank of America, With Merrill’s Help, Returns to Profit
headline.print_headline: Bank of America, With Merrill’s Help, Returns to Profit
